solution_line_template: If Kaydence's father is {father_age} years old, her mother is {father_age}-{mother_age_difference} = <<{father_age}-{mother_age_difference}={mother_age}>>{mother_age} years old.
The total age of the mother and father is {father_age}+{mother_age} = <<{father_age}+{mother_age}={father_mother_total_age}>>{father_mother_total_age} years
Kaydence's brother is half the father's age, which is {brother_age_fraction}*{father_age} =<<{brother_age_fraction}*{father_age}={brother_age}>>{brother_age} years.

The total age of Kaydence's father, mother, and brother is {brother_age}+{father_mother_total_age}= <<{brother_age}+{father_mother_total_age}={father_mother_brother_total_age}>>{father_mother_brother_total_age} years.

If you add Kaydence's sister's age to the total age of the father, mother, and brother, you get {father_mother_brother_total_age}+{sister_age} = <<{father_mother_brother_total_age}+{sister_age}={family_members_known_total_age}>>{family_members_known_total_age} years.

If everyone's age in the family is {total_family_age}, then Kaydence's age is {total_family_age}-{family_members_known_total_age} = <<{total_family_age}-{family_members_known_total_age}={kaydence_age}>>{kaydence_age} years old.
